    • Constructor Detail

      • UserService

        public UserService()

    • Method Detail

      • getAll

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getAll(User loggedInUser)
        Returns All the Users in the Database depending on the Role of the User. ADMIN: Can get ALL the Users. DIRECTOR: Can get only the Employees of his company. MANAGER: Can get only his Colleagues. ELSE: FORBIDDEN
        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The user who logged in.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity with the list of Users.

      • getById

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getById(User loggedInUser,
                                                       Integer id)
        Returns the User with the Requested ID. ADMIN: Can get ALL the Users. DIRECTOR, MANAGER: Can only get colleagues and itself. ELSE: FORBIDDEN
        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The user who logged in.
        id - The ID of the User to GET.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity with the Requested User.

      • getUnassignedDirectors

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getUnassignedDirectors(User loggedInUser)
        Returns Users who are not directors of any Companies. ADMIN: Can get all. ELSE: FORBIDDEN
        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The user who logged in.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity with the requested Users

      • putById

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity putById(UserDTO userDTO,
                                                       User loggedInUser,
                                                       Integer id)
        Updates a User by ID. ADMIN: Can Update all the users. DIRECTOR: Can only Update itself and Employees. MANAGER: Can only Update itself. ELSE: FORBIDDEN
        Parameters:
        userDTO - The user Data Transfer Object with the updated information.
        loggedInUser - The user who logged in.
        id - The ID of the User to Update.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity with the updated User.

      • registerUser

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity registerUser(UserDTO userDTO,
                                                            User loggedInUser)
        Registers a new user to the Database. ADMIN: Can register any Users with any role. DIRECTOR: Can only register employees to his company. MANAGER: FORBIDDEN Already existing User: BAD REQUEST Non existing User: NOTFOUND
        Parameters:
        userDTO - The user (Data Transfer Object) to register
        loggedInUser - The user who wants to register a new User.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity of the saved User.

      • getEmployeesOfUser

        public Iterable<User> getEmployeesOfUser(User user)
        Returns the Employees of the user.
        Parameters:
        user - The User to get Employees of.
        Returns:
        Returns an ArrayList of Users.

      • getColleaguesOfUser

        public Iterable<User> getColleaguesOfUser(User user)
        Returns the Colleagues of the user.
        Parameters:
        user - The User to get Colleagues of.
        Returns:
        Returns an ArrayList of Users.

      • enableUser

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity enableUser(Integer id,
                                                          User loggedInUser)
        Enables a User by ID. ADMIN: Can enable any Users without any regulations. DIRECTOR: Can enable only employees. ELSE: FORBIDDEN Non existing User: NOTFOUND
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the User the user wants to enable.
        loggedInUser - The user logged in.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity: OK if the operation was successful and NotFound if the record was not found.

      • disableUser

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity disableUser(Integer id,
                                                           User loggedInUser)
        Disables a User by ID. ADMIN: Can disable any Users without any regulations. DIRECTOR: Can disable only employees. ELSE: FORBIDDEN Non existing User: NOTFOUND
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the User the user wants to disable.
        loggedInUser - The user logged in.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity: OK if the operation was successful and NotFound if the record was not found.

      • deleteById

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deleteById(Integer id,
                                                          User loggedInUser)
        Deletes User record by ID. ADMIN: Can delete any Users without any regulations. DIRECTOR: Can delete only employees. ELSE: FORBIDDEN If user has any Orders or History or Managers, then cannot be deleted: NOT_ACCEPTABLE is thrown and the connected Orders and Histories are returned. Non existing User: NOTFOUND
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the User the user wants to DELETE.
        loggedInUser - The user logged in.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity: OK if the deletion was successful and NotFound if the record was not found.

      • getValidUser

        public User getValidUser(String username)
        Checks if the Requested user is valid and Enabled.
        Parameters:
        username - Name of the user to check
        Returns:
        Returns a Valid user

      • userHasRole

        public boolean userHasRole(User user,
                           Role role)
        Checks if the User has the role.
        Parameters:
        user - The User to check
        role - The Role to check.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • userHasRole

        public boolean userHasRole(User user,
                           List<Role> roles)
        Checks if the User has any of the listed roles.
        Parameters:
        user - The User to check
        roles - The Roles to check.
        Returns:
        boolean
